thread.title: TV News | UFC Fight Night Dublin to be broadcast live on 3e
thread.title_full: TV News | UFC Fight Night Dublin to be broadcast live on 3e - entertainment.ie

author: Jason Brennan
title: TV News | UFC Fight Night Dublin to be broadcast live on 3e
text:
3e have today announced their deal to show the UFC Dublin Fight Night live on Saturday, 24th October.
The event, which sold out in a record breaking 60 seconds, will have its entire main card broadcast from 9pm-11pm, but will also feature a "UFC Fight Night Dublin Breakdown" at 8pm. The show will give you a rundown of the fights and fighters featuring on the night.
The main card will feature two Irish fighters, with Paddy Hoolohan taking on Louis Smolka, while Joe Duffy will headline against previous Conor McGregor opponent, Dustin Poirier.
No.3 and no.7 ranked heavyweights Stipe Miocic and Ben Rothwell are co-headlining, with welterweights Nicholas Dalby and Darren Till filling up the rest of the card.
With 600,000 people tuning in this time last year to see Conor McGregor KO Dustin Poirier, we can only imagine the figures will be even higher this time around, with the sports popularity in the country having soared over the past 12 months.
The undercard for the event, which sees Irish fighters Cathal Pendred, Aisling Daly, Neil Seery, and Norman Parke all step inside the octagon will be solely available on UFC's Fight Pass streaming service.
